meanings.definition: Curved in shape like an arch.
meanings.sent1: The arched doorway led into a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent2: The bridge had an arched design to allow boats to pass underneath.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to jump through the arched window but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her eyebrows arched in surprise when she saw the birthday cake.
meanings.sent5: The arched rainbow stretched across the sky after the rainstorm.

meanings.definition: To form or make into an arch.
meanings.sent1: She arched her back to stretch after sitting for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The architect arched the entrance of the building for a grand entrance.
meanings.sent3: The baker arched the dough into a perfect circle before baking.
meanings.sent4: He arched his eyebrows in disbelief at the outrageous story.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast arched gracefully over the balance beam during her routine.

meanings.definition: Having a curved or arched shape.
meanings.sent1: The arched bridge spanned the river, connecting the two sides of the city.
meanings.sent2: The arched ceiling of the cathedral soared high above the worshippers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail formed an arched shape as it pounced on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches arched gracefully over the path, creating a natural canopy.
meanings.sent5: The arched doorway framed the stunning view of the mountains in the distance.
